headline: Lemon Asparagus Risotto
description: This deliciously creamy asparagus risotto is packed with bright, fresh flavors. Lemon juice and zest add extra zing to this springtime dish.
name: Lemon Asparagus Risotto

recipeInstructions.text: Place a steamer insert into a saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steamer. Bring water to a boil. Add asparagus, cover, and steam until tender, about 5 minutes. Cut asparagus into 1-inch pieces; set aside.
Meanwhile, heat chicken broth in a saucepan over medium heat; keep at a simmer while preparing risotto.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and celery; cook and stir until vegetables are tender, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and black pepper. Stir in Arborio rice and garlic; cook and stir until rice is lightly toasted, about 5 more minutes.

Stir in white wine and simmer until it has mostly evaporated, then stir in 1/3 of the hot chicken broth; continue stirring until rice has absorbed liquid and turned creamy. Repeat this process twice more, stirring constantly. Stirring in the broth should take 15 to 20 minutes in all. When finished, rice should be tender yet firm to the bite. Stir in asparagus.
Remove from heat and mix in Parmesan cheese, lemon juice, and lemon zest. Serve immediately.

review.reviewBody: Easy and delicious
This was just so delicious, really light and refreshing. I followed the recipe to the letter. Perfect. I will definitely be making it again. Thanks for the recipe.
Delicious! I recommend serving it with fish or chicken. It was not enough dinner for my family on its own with a side of broccoli.
This recipe is a keeper. It paired nicely with a rack of lamb.
Loved this! Creamy texture. Lemon makes a nice addition. I pan seared a couple of scallops and served on the side.
This was fantastic and easy to make. I used water and a little extra wine instead of the broth (didn't have any) and it was very good! Will surely make again. Served with some lemon dill cod.
Delicious. We did not add the white wine and it was great. We also reduced the lemon juice as it seemed to be too much.

Absolutely delicious! This was my first attempt at making risotto and after reading the recipe and tips it turned exactly like I imagined. I did cut the olive oil in half and added butter to make up the difference to sauté the onions and celery. Also, I added creme fraiche (about 4oz) once I was finished with the stock and just before the asparagus. It gave an even creamier texture. It is a labor of love and I’d recommend getting all of the ingredients measured out and laid out in order of use by the stove. The process is involved it’s easier to have you 1/2 cup of wine ready for you by the stove. Thank you for such a great recipe!

This was so good! My first time making risotto and it came out great. My teenage boys and husband are finishing it off as I write this. I served it with blackened salmon and roasted carrots and it was a great match. Also, I'm trying to cut a few calories so I took out a portion for myself before adding the parmesan---still really good.
Excellent recipe! I added frozen peas and shrimp to this and we all enjoyed our dinner.
I did not make a single change to this delicious recipe. Shame on those who did and who also used a crock pot! This is so Italian and authentic!
This was really good! My husband asked why I never made it before. It was my first attempt at making risotto. Pretty happy with how it turned out.
Used lamb stock/ beef stock since we had it and roasted the asparagus in the oven on 350 degrees while the risotto was cooking. Awesome recipe!

So this took a lot longer to cook and required more broth but I’m blaming the burner I was cooking on. This is a perfect risotto recipe! The lemon zest really brightens it up. I roasted my asparagus because that’s how I prefer it. Will definitely make again.

Always a favorite! Hubby loves this and gets excited when I make it. I usually make it just as the recipe describes except with a little less asparagus. I use 8 spears if they are thicker and about 15 if they are thin. Love keeping the burner on medium while mixing in the broth. Really cuts down on cooking time and still keeps rice slightly al dente. I turn the burner down to medium-low when mixing I have more time.
Excellent! We about licked the plates . Great balance between the lemon and rice
Next time going to do in a pot vs. The large skillet I used so rice absorbs liquid vs. It evaporating. Did lemon garlic scallops with it.

Loved the recipe. The changes I made were that I used less than 20 asparagus spears (14), and that I used more than 4 cups of chicken broth. My rice was not cooked through with 4 cups of broth, I ended up using approximately 5 cups. 
Would definitely make again. Was time consuming/labor intensive, however, end product was very good.
Extremely good. I will make it again.

Made this for dinner tonight to go with Lemon Garlic Butter Scallops. such a great complement to the Scallops! Definitely a keeper! Wouldn't change a thing! BTW, I did roast my asparagus in the oven for 10 minutes at 350° with just a drizzle of EVOO and S/P.
Easy recipe with ingredients already at home. Delicious - followed recipe exactly, but added a little too much lemon juice. Will definitely make again. Hubby and I give it two thumbs up!
Delicious! I replaced the celery with carrots and the white wine with white wine vinegar, because that's what I had.

Excellent dish! I scaled it down to 2 servings, having some for dinner tonight with leftovers. My asparagus were a little thicker, so I steamed them for a few min longer. The lemon is really good here, giving it a nice, fresh, springtime flavor. I skipped the lemon zest. Thanks for this great recipe that I'll surely enjoy again! UPDATE: Used half asparagus and half mushrooms. Very good! I added mushrooms with celery/onion saute; may be better to saute separately and add at end with asparagus. UPDATE: If adding mushrooms, much better sauteeing for ~5 min separately, then adding when asparagus is added.

Made it almost as per the recipe. I don't drink often and never have wine, so rather not spend the money to get a bottle I just end up throwing out. My wine substitute is ginger ale, seems to work well. 

Also, the asparagus I was using was thick (out of season) so I didn't use as many stocks as was suggested but there still seemed to be more than enough.
Had to use broccoli instead, but it was still very tasty. Mixed in some chicken and we had leftovers for the next two days.
Delicious! Didn’t have lemon, but still fabulous!
My first time trying to make a risotto and this was amazing!

Pretty good risotto for a low fat version! I liked the flavor that the lemon zest added to it but would cut down on the lemon juice as I didn't care for the sour note in the risotto. To avoid having too many dishes to wash, I sauteed the cut up asparagus in the same skillet I was going to make the risotto in.
Paired well with Alton Brown's Chicken Parm.

Super easy and, more importantly, everyone liked it and wanted more. I cooked chicken breasts in a lemon garlic vinaigrette, sliced them up, and served it all together in a bid pasta bowl. Great dinner!
Delicious made just as instructed. We loved it.
This recipe was delicious! Yes, risotto can be a bit monotonous to make but the end result was a highly delicious flavor. Perfect for those folks out there who adore asparagus in everything.!
Only change I made was to use Asiago cheese. I have made this so many times. It’s always a favourite

Outstanding! Definitely one of my favorite recipes on this site now! That's saying a lot because there are MANY wonderful recipes on here!

I added 12 oz shrimp to make it a complete meal, but that's it. I used the stated amount of liquids with no issues whatsoever.

 My only regret is that I didn't double this. We finished it all and there were no LEFTOVERS :-(
Note to self... MAKE EXTRA!!!

Slow and steady wins the race! Excellent and I’ve tried many! The lemon taste was a bit much for my young kids but is adults loved it so lower of littles are joining you. Only things I did different were to save time. Cleaned and diced the asparagus and threw in the simmering broth for a few minutes then removed and cooled with water to stop the cooking until ready to add to mix at end. Made for a wonderful crunch! Must be patient but yes all four cups will soak in! Will make again! Thank you

Absolutely delicious! Used plain rice and otherwise followed the recipe exactly. The asparagus was al dente, just like I like it and the rice was creamy and tasty with just the right amount of lemon. Anyone making risotto should realize it takes constant stirring, so either have all other parts of the meal timed to finish without attention at the same time, or have a handy helper like I did.

Delicious! I was able to modify the cooking method to do it in the instant pot (following the IP mushroom risotto recipe on this site). Rookie mistake: I cut off a uniform amount from the stalk bottoms instead of breaking each off which means I had a substantial amount of "wood" in my risotto. Lesson learned, break each stalk!
Fantastic! I really liked the idea of the lemon zest and juice - I never thought about it for risotto. This is a definite keeper, and I'll be making this often.

Great recipe. First time making risotto and it turned out great. It does take a little more time but well worth it! Only change I made was to omit the celery, but perfect otherwise! Thanks for the recipe!

I LOVE risotto but was always intimidated to make it. This recipe was so easy and the risotto was so creamy and wonderful. Yes it takes work (constant stirring) but so worth it! I followed the recipe exactly and wouldn’t change a thing.
Incredible! I bbq’d the asparagus for some extra fun.
I will make it again. Added a few more veggies very good
Fantastic. I use more wine and parm, and it turns out wonderfully.

Cooked this in the Insta Pot or the other name Pressure Cooker..only takes six (6) minutes and only a couple of minutes of stirring..put in Olive Oil..Garlic...Onion...stirred about two minutes...then some wine...seasoning 1 quart of boiling chicken broth..put the top on...set for Risotto..7 minutes done and perfect..wow this was so good.

AMAZING! The only thing I changed was using broccoli instead of asparagus because I cannot abide asparagus. Great flavor and texture, and it reheats incredibly well. I broiled up some cod to go with it, and my husband could not stop raving about how good it was. Definitely a keeper!
added porcini mushrooms-very yummy and worth the effort!

I made this recipe last night and it was delish! I have a large family, so I doubled the recipe. I didn’t have quite enough chicken broth, so I added some of the water from steaming the asparagus in with the broth I had, and it’s worked out just fine. I used two scallions instead of regular onion, and I tripled the amount of garlic (we really love garlic!). I did not include celery since I had none on hand, And after the risottos was cooked and removed from the heat, I added about a half a cup of half and half along with some extra Parmesan as the risotto I grew up enjoying was extremely creamy and cheesy. It came out perfectly! I served it along side my homemade shrimp scampi, and it was a nice change from the pasta I typically serve with it. THanks so much for a fantastic recip!!!
I added diced tomatoes, and 1teas. of Ranch Seasoning Mix !! Yes, will do again,& again!! Thanks for sharing...
Loved it, did not change a thing.

First time making risotto and this recipe was excellent! Although it might seem tedious with the constant stirring after adding each ladle of broth, it is well worth the effort! The cook time was spot on for me and I used barely under the amount of broth called for in the recipe. I steamed the asparagus as directed and can't wait to try it with roasted or grilled asparagus. Made this to go along with Chef John's Grilled Swordfish Bruschetta. Now that I know how to make risotto, I can't wait to try it in the Instant Pot! Thanks for the recipe!
Love it. I used a little more chicken broth than the recipe called for, and followed recommendation to add in the celery at the end of cooking, so it has a little crunch. Can't wait to cook it again!
This dish was amazing!!! Thanks for sharing all your tips.

Made as directed other than a bit of extra wine and twice as much garlic. Steamed fresh spring asparagus in the microwave and added it near the end including the water the asparagus cooked in. So good!!!
Outstanding recipe! First time making risotto and you made me look like a pro! Followed directions to the letter. I will make this dish over and over again!
This is a really good risotto. I paired it with salmon which was simply prepared with sat, pepper, olive oil and lemon and it was the perfect combo. Thank you for posting the recipe!
I’ve made this for my husband and he loves it. Don’t forget the lemon-it’s needed to cut the richness and brighten the dish.
I made it as written and it is fantastic! The flavours are perfectly balanced, rich and creamy without the guilt of butter or cream. Thanks for sharing!
This is very good. I used wild rice & white rice because I didn't have what it called for. I will not use the lemon zest the next time & I will add more cheese. Still very delicious!!
It was really good and so easy to make! Even my kid who basically hates anything that isn't completely plain loved it. Having it again tonight for dinner!
I grilled the asparagus a bit, rather than steaming, and added grilled shrimp at the end. Very tasty, and my daughter beat me to the leftovers.
It turned out perfect! Followed it exactly as written.

I adapted this recipe to make in my InstantPot® (so much easier, and not standing and stirring). Steamed the asparagus as directed, then sauteed the onions and celery in the IP, using the saute feature. Added the garlic, wine then only 2 cups of chicken broth. Sealed and set on manual for 6 minutes. At the end of the 6 minutes, I released the pressure, opened the pot and added the asparagus and switched to "keep warm" until hubs finished cutting the lawn! Right before serving, I added the parmesan and lemon juice as directed. It was really good, and I'll make it again, this very same way.
Amazing recipe. Had to use a lot more liquid. Next time try larger ladle size to keep grains entirely wet at all times to allow them to fluff. Did asparagus on the BBQ then added.
I added shrimp to complete the dish. It was a huge hit at my dinner party. Time consuming, but what risotto isn't?

Made it as instructed, minus the asparagus. Didn't have any and was I was just looking for a regular lemon risotto anyway. It was good and I'd make it again. 
BUT...
After I tried it I decided to sauté some mushrooms, garlic and capers in butter and mixed that in. Then wilted some spinach and mixed that in with fresh basil and cilantro. To me, it took what was good and made it great.
Would definitely make again. Great summer dish
Will definitely make this again!
Is there a Risotto that tasted bad? Nope! This one is just as good as any other... it's the cheese that makes it taste so good!
Great risotto - love the lemon finish.
Made the recipe several times as written and it always turns out delicious!

Will for sure make this again. I didn't have asparagus but it didn't seem to matter I used kale. Also didn't have a real lemon so no zest and I added the lemon juice with my last laddel of water so it wouldn't be so over poweringly tart. I always had my own spices so I would recommend doing that to the tastes

This is the first risotta I have ever made. It was super tasty. I served it with a roasted lemon chicken and the two played really well off each other. My boyfriend and roommate also raved about it. Highly recommend.

Really nice, served this with Salmon Wellington (found on this site). Used bouillon cubes for stock, found it too salty. If I didn't add the extra salt, it would likely have been fine. Used fresh lemon juice and zest as ~Lisa~ recommended, great results.
Easy recipe (as risotto goes!) and nice mellow flavor... Seems to need something, just not sure. More garlic? Less onion? More cheese and butter? Adding veggies earlier? But nice as a side dish.
Made it exactly like the recipe. It was good, but I still like the other risotto recipe on here that uses corn, tomatoes, and basil!

I added too much lemon pepper (since I didn't have any lemons). I added in some extra Parmesan to to cut through the lemon and it tasted great! I cut the recipe in half and I still have enough left overs to being to lunch! lol
I skipped the celery and added diced zucchini instead, because that was what I had on hand. It was delicious, and I will definitely make it again!

Loved it! Yes, it's tedious to add liquid one scoop at a time, but if you wanted something quick, buy a pre-made mix. My 2 year old granddaughter had thirds.... And that's unheard of! (quantifier: she ate around the asparagus after the first helping). Will absolutely make again!

Great recipe!!!! I used only 1 tbsp of fresh squeezed lemon juice instead of 2 as the recipe suggested as I just wanted a very mild lemon taste. Served this with pan fried cod and the combination was delicious. Next time will definitely try it with scallops.

This was "you-have-got-to-be-kidding-me" good! Best risotto I have ever had, let alone made! I didn't even bother making a protein to go with it, all I needed was a spoon and a moment to myself! Yum, yum, yum!
Great flavour! Definitely making this one again
Very tedious and takes a very long time. I thought it was fairly bland and but my husband thought it was alright! I still have some risotto leftover, so I might take a stab at this recipe again.
Love all the flavors, but the lemon gives it a bit of a sharp taste, that we didn't care for. We love risotto and have made it with asparagus but never adding the lemon. Back to my old recipe.
Followed this recipe as is and I thought it turned out great. Just the right amount of liquid, and it had a nice, bright flavor (definitely don't skip the fresh lemon juice and zest).
This recipe was amazing! I used one tablespoon of lemon zest instead and using fresh squeezed lemon was definitely a key component. 100% five star dish.
I added sliced mushrooms just before you add the white wine and they add some good body to the recipe. Otherwise, this recipe is awesome!

I was very excited to make this recipe again. I had two extra cups of chicken stock available an it did take longer than the 20 minutes, but I am learning. The first time I made it I felt it was too lemony, this time I cut back to one Table Spoon of the lemon juice and did use the required amount of Lemon Zest. It is so very good! And we did serve with Scallops! What a great meal! Thank you!

I made this recipe for our anniversary dinner. I made only one change, by not pre-cooking the asparagus, but adding it during the last few minutes of cooking. It is a lovely dish. The flavour of the parmesan, hinted by the zing of the lemon juice and zest, together with the creaminess of the rice were perfect. My husband loved it. I made 1.5 batches at once so I could freeze some for later too!
This was very good. Very easy to make. I served with pan seared scallops
This turned out quite nicely, and tastes great with scallops!
Risotto seems to be kind of a chef's true test. I had never had it before and it turned out awesome! Thanks for a great recipe that takes the mystery out of this intimidating dish :)
Pretty good and easy! Followed the recipe except for the celery.
We LOVED this recipe! We made it exactly how the recipe was written. Will make this again and again.

This recipe was great! my first time making a risotto, I did just like the other reviewers said, followed the recipe exactly, and it was DELICIOUS! i wouldn't change a thing. My boyfriends mother repeatedly said "its like a 5 star restaurant!" Thanks so much for dispelling my fear of risottos and making me look like a master chef. I can't wait to make it again!

This is a wonderful recipe. It does take some care with all the stirring. We found it to be a two person job. Next time I will cut the lemon in half. Added mushrooms. Served as a side to pork chops. Lovely meal.
good, gsl liked. made with veal chop

Super easy risotto to make! It was delicious!! I didn't use low-sodium broth, and we left out the celery and Parmesan cheese. Next time I will not put in any lemon zest or lemon juice, as the kids didn't like the lemony flavor...

Fantastic! Will certainly make again. Because I was having green beans as a side, I left out the asparagus in this dish. And I nearly doubled the risotto used. With just one cup, it never would have been enough for four servings. That said, I used the called-for amount of chicken broth. I also left out the zest.

This was very enjoyable! It was my first time making risotto, and it took longer than I know it should have. I think maybe my heat was too high? My broth seemed to absorb or disappear too fast and yet I needed more than the 4 cups of broth for the rice to be tender (not a full cup more). It took about 35 minutes from the time I added the wine to achieve a nice texture. I followed the recipe exactly outside of the timing and used canned lemon juice, no zest. The flavors in this dish are WONDERFUL!
